message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.CY 

This paper discusses a Bayesian analysis of how the meaning of an utterance can differ from a speaker's intended meaning, which involves sophisticated model-based perspective-taking and reasoning about the history of the state of the world. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), social and information networks (cs.SD), and cybernetics (cs.CY).
